Race.GeneralTitle: Democratic Parish Executive Committee Member at Large
Republican Parish Executive Committee Member at Large

Race.SpecificTitle: Gravity Drainage Dist. No. 6 -- 1/2% S&U Tax - BOC
Race.SummaryText:
Gravity Drainage District No. 6 Proposition
(Sales and Use Tax)

Summary:  Levy and collection of one-half of one percent (1/2%) sales and use tax, in perpetuity, from the effective first levy date of July 1, 2012, for the purpose of acquiring drainage and flood prevention works, rights-of-way for canals and ditches, equipment and facilities necessary to construct, maintain and operate outlets for the waters of the District and to prevent flooding.
Race.FullText: Shall Gravity Drainage District No. 6 of the Parish of Livingston, State of Louisiana (the "District"), under the provisions of Article VI, Section 32 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974, La. R.S. 38:1805.1, and other constitutional and statutory authority, be authorized to levy and collect a tax of one-half of one percent (1/2%) (an estimated $567,082 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) ("the Tax"), upon the sale at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption and the storage for use or consumption of tangible personal property and/or sales of services in the District, all as defined by law, in perpetuity from the effective first levy date of July 1, 2012 for the purpose of acquiring drainage and flood prevention works, rights-of-way for canals and ditches, equipment and facilities necessary to construct, maintain and operate outlets for the waters of the District and to prevent flooding; and shall the District be further authorized to fund the proceeds of the Tax into bonds from time to time for any of said capital improvements, to the extent and in the manner permitted by the laws of Louisiana?
